Description: Flu is a contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses, leading to fever and cough.
Migraine is a severe headache disorder often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light.
Common Cold is a viral infection causing nasal congestion, sneezing, and mild symptoms.
Allergies occur when the immune system overreacts to substances like pollen or dust.
Gastritis is inflammation of the stomach lining, causing pain and digestive discomfort.
UTI is a bacterial infection in the urinary system, causing painful and frequent urination.
Conjunctivitis, or pink eye, is an infection or inflammation of the eye's surface.
A sprained ankle is an injury to the ankle ligaments, causing pain and swelling.
Hypertension, or high blood pressure, strains the heart and blood vessels.
Diabetes is a chronic condition where blood sugar levels are high due to insulin problems.
Asthma is a lung condition causing breathing difficulties due to inflamed airways.
Arthritis is joint inflammation, leading to pain and reduced mobility.
Hepatitis B is a viral liver infection spread through blood or bodily fluids.
Pneumonia is a lung infection causing cough, fever, and breathing difficulties.
Bronchitis is inflammation of the bronchial tubes, causing cough and mucus.
GERD is acid reflux causing heartburn and chest discomfort from stomach acid.
Eczema is a chronic skin condition causing itchy, inflamed patches.
Psoriasis is a chronic autoimmune condition causing scaly, red skin patches.
HIV/AIDS is a viral infection that weakens the immune system over time.
Chlamydia is a bacterial sexually transmitted infection affecting the genitals.
Measles is a highly contagious viral infection causing fever and a distinctive rash.
Chickenpox is a viral infection causing an itchy rash and fever, common in children.
Dengue Fever is a mosquito-borne viral illness causing severe fever and pain.
Malaria is a parasitic infection spread by mosquitoes, causing fever and chills.
Tuberculosis is a bacterial lung infection spread through coughing.
Meningitis is an infection of the brain and spinal cord membranes.
Whooping Cough is a bacterial infection causing intense coughing fits.

Precautions: Avoid tick bites,check skin after outdoor activity
Description: Lyme Disease is a bacterial infection from tick bites, causing rash and joint pain.
Shingles is a viral infection causing a painful rash, often in older adults.
Gout is a type of arthritis caused by uric acid buildup, leading to joint pain.
Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition causing widespread pain and fatigue.
Osteoporosis weakens bones, increasing the risk of fractures.
Rosacea is a chronic skin condition causing facial redness and pimples.
Scleroderma is an autoimmune disease causing skin and tissue hardening.
Pemphigus is a rare autoimmune disorder causing skin and mouth blisters.
Fibrous Dysplasia is a bone disorder where normal bone is replaced with fibrous tissue.
Raynaud’s Phenomenon causes fingers and toes to feel cold and numb due to blood vessel spasms.
Reactive Arthritis is joint inflammation triggered by an infection elsewhere in the body.
Scoliosis is an abnormal sideways curvature of the spine.
Alzheimer’s is a progressive brain disorder affecting memory and cognitive function.
Parkinson’s is a brain disorder causing movement problems like tremors and stiffness.
Breast Cancer is a malignant growth in breast tissue, often detected as a lump.
Peptic Ulcer is a sore in the stomach or small intestine lining, causing burning pain.
Chronic Fatigue Syndrome causes severe, persistent tiredness not relieved by rest.
Endometriosis is a condition where uterine tissue grows outside the uterus, causing pain.
PCOS is a hormonal disorder affecting reproductive and metabolic health.
Hyperlipidemia is high cholesterol or triglycerides, increasing heart disease risk.
Menstrual Cramps are painful sensations in the lower abdomen during menstruation.
Obesity is excessive body weight, increasing risks for heart disease and diabetes.
Atopic Dermatitis is a chronic skin condition causing itching and inflamed skin.
Anemia is a condition with low red blood cells, causing tiredness and weakness.
Celiac Disease is an autoimmune disorder triggered by gluten, damaging the small intestine.
Epilepsy is a neurological disorder causing recurrent seizures.
Thyroiditis is inflammation of the thyroid gland, affecting hormone production.
Lupus is an autoimmune disease causing inflammation in joints, skin, and organs.
Kidney Stones are hard deposits in the kidneys, causing intense pain.
Glaucoma is an eye condition damaging the optic nerve, leading to vision loss.
Hepatitis C is a viral infection causing liver inflammation and potential damage.
Diverticulitis is inflammation of pouches in the colon, causing pain.
Chronic Kidney Disease is progressive kidney damage, reducing filtration ability.
IBS is a chronic disorder affecting the large intestine, causing digestive issues.
Tonsillitis is inflammation of the tonsils, often due to bacterial or viral infection.
Sciatica is pain along the sciatic nerve, often due to a herniated disc.
Otitis Media is a middle ear infection, common in children, causing pain.
Hemorrhoids are swollen veins in the rectum, causing discomfort and bleeding.
Sleep Apnea is a disorder causing breathing pauses during sleep.
Prostate Enlargement is a common condition in older men, affecting urination.
Gallstones are hardened deposits in the gallbladder, causing pain and digestive issues.
Anxiety Disorder involves excessive worry and fear, impacting daily life.
Depression is a mood disorder causing persistent sadness and loss of interest.
Bipolar Disorder involves extreme mood swings, from mania to depression.
Schizophrenia is a mental disorder causing distorted thinking and perceptions.
ADHD is a neurodevelopmental disorder affecting focus and behavior.
Autism is a developmental disorder affecting communication and behavior.
Cushing’s Syndrome is caused by excess cortisol, leading to weight gain.
Hyperthyroidism is overactive thyroid causing rapid metabolism and weight loss.
Hypothyroidism is underactive thyroid causing slow metabolism and fatigue.
Multiple Sclerosis is an autoimmune disease affecting the nervous system.
ALS is a progressive neurodegenerative disease affecting motor neurons.
Stroke is a sudden interruption of blood flow to the brain, causing damage.
Heart Failure is when the heart cannot pump blood effectively.
PAD is narrowed arteries reducing blood flow to limbs, causing pain.
DVT is a blood clot in a deep vein, often in the leg.
Pulmonary Embolism is a blood clot blocking a lung artery, causing breathing issues.
Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas, causing severe abdominal pain.
Leukemia is a blood cancer affecting white blood cells, causing fatigue.
Lymphoma is a cancer of the lymphatic system, causing lymph node swelling.
Ovarian Cancer is a malignant growth in the ovaries, often detected late.
Cervical Cancer is a malignancy in the cervix, often linked to HPV.
Rheumatoid Arthritis is an autoimmune disorder causing chronic joint inflammation.
Sjogren’s Syndrome is an autoimmune disorder affecting moisture-producing glands.
